head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Volunteer Group Official Is Sentenced

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Volunteer Group Official Is Sentenced

block.p: A former executive vice president of the nonprofit group 100 Black Men of New Jersey was sentenced yesterday in Federal District Court to 21 months in prison for fraudulently obtaining $156,000 from the organization, federal prosecutors said. The former officer, Keith DaCosta, 44, of Newark, admitted using bank accounts affiliated with the organization for personal use, including hotel stays, meals and a $374 hat, and entering into leases for office equipment with his personal home health care company, said Christopher J. Christie, the United States attorney.

A former executive vice president of the nonprofit group 100 Black Men of New Jersey was sentenced yesterday in Federal District Court to 21 months in prison for fraudulently obtaining $156,000 from the organization, federal prosecutors said. The former officer, Keith DaCosta, 44, of Newark, admitted using bank accounts affiliated with the organization for personal use, including hotel stays, meals and a $374 hat, and entering into leases for office equipment with his personal home health care company, said Christopher J. Christie, the United States attorney.
